description: From Middle English instruccioun, from Old French instruccion, from Latin instructio; equivalent to instruct +â€Ž -ion.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The act of instructing, teaching, or furnishing with information or knowledge.
examples: Students receive instruction in the arts and sciences.
Instruction will be provided on how to handle difficult customers.

entries.meaning: (countable) An instance of the information or knowledge so furnished.
(computing) A single operation of a processor defined by an instruction set architecture.
A set of directions provided by a manufacturer for the users of a product or service.
